title.narrative: Assistance to GoV - Gaua Volcano Situation

description.narrative: Since the middle of September visual observations have indicated some activity of the Mont Garet volcano. Explosions of the volcano could be heard by the population located at the West coast (since the 29th of September) who have since been incurring ash falls and gas emissions. An initial assessment team was deployed by the Geohazard section of Department of Geology, Mines &#38;#38; Rural Water Supply (DGMWRS) from 3 to 7 October 2009. The objective of the mission was to confirm the information reported, to evaluate the impact of gases and ashes on the villages affected and to install a seismic station to collect and read seismic data sets in order to evaluate the state of the volcanic activity. On 13 October 2009, the DGMWRS raised the level alert of the volcano to 2 on the Vanuatu Volcano Alert Level. The villages on the Western part of Gaua were prone to ash and volcanic gases because of their locality in relation to the direction of the trade winds. Since then, the technicians of the DG
